FuncDef:
The port-queue wfq command configures the weighted fair queuing (WFQ) parameters of a queue on a low-speed interface. To configure WFQ scheduling parameters for other interfaces, run the port-queue command.
The undo port-queue command restores the default configuration.
By default, WFQ applies to the BE, AF1, AF2, AF3, and AF4 queues. The percentages of the CIRs in the interface bandwidth are respectively 15%, 15%, 20%, 25% and 25%, and the PIR is the interface bandwidth.
CLIs: port-queue { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 } wfq shaping cir { <cir-value> | percentage <cir-percent> } [ pir { <pir-value> | percentage <pir-percent> } ]
undo port-queue { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the service level of a queue as be.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af1.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af2.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af3.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af4.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as ef.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as cs6.
-

Specifies the CIR value.
The value is an integer ranging from 8 to the interface bandwidth minus 8 (not greater than 64000), in kbit/s. The value is 0 if the interface bandwidth is 0.

Specifies the percentage of the CIR in the interface bandwidth.
The value is an integer ranging from the percentage of 8 kbit/s in the interface bandwidth to 100 minus the percentage of 8 kbit/s in the interface bandwidth.

Specifies the percentage of the PIR in the interface bandwidth.
The value is an integer ranging from the CIR plus the percentage of 8 kbit/s in the interface bandwidth to 100.

Specifies the PIR value.
The value is an integer ranging from the CIR plus 8 to a non-0 interface bandwidth (not greater than 64008), in kbit/s. The value is 0 if the interface bandwidth is 0.

Specifies the service level of a queue as cs7.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-Serial1/0/0/1:0] port-queue af1 wfq shaping cir percentage 10 pir percentage 20
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A low-speed interface has a low bandwidth and is prone to traffic congestion. After WFQ applies to a queue, higher-priority queues are allocated a higher weight and are guaranteed a higher bandwidth.
Precautions
If you run the port-queue wfq command repeatedly, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
The sum of queues' CIR percentages (cir-percent) cannot exceed 100%.The port-queue wfq weight and port-queue wfq shaping cir commands are mutually exclusive.
